Posts.Content: FREE, DROP-IN WOMEN'S VIRTUAL, LIVE BREAST CANCER SUPPORT GROUP Thursday, May 2 @ 8 pm EDT, 7 pm CDT, 6 pm MDT, 5 pm PDT We recognize many women and their caregivers want to attend a physical BCa support group ... but 'stuff' gets in the way! > no group within easy geographical reach > kids or elderly parents don't afford the time > physical disability makes it hard to travel > not so comfortable in a room with many others AnCan (Answer Cancer Foundation, a 501c3), home of peer-led virtual support groups, hosts our WOMEN"S BREAST CANCER SUPPORT GROUP on the 1st Thursday of every month at 8 pm EST and invites you to participate .... dial-in or join online - see below. No fee, no registration. This group is totally interactive with audio and optional video connection. Our women's breast cancer group is moderated by Helen Tomasko, a long-term survivor of complex disease; Helen has moderated a breast cancer survivors support group at Ann's Place in Danbury, CT for several years. Our virtual group welcomes all survivors and their caregivers. We recognize BCa comes in all shapes and sizes. This group welcomes all - right now we only have numbers for a single group but as with other conditions, AnCan will readily split into more focused groups as participants present themselves. AnCan is also proud to sponsor a male breast cancer group in partnership with the Male Breast Cancer Coalition. That group meets every 4th Thursday - next meeting will be on Thursday, Jan 28, 2019 at 6 pm Eastern. For more information please visit: https://ancan.org Contact: Helen Tomasko helent@ancan.org (moderator), or Rick Davis info@ancan.org +1 415 505 0924 --------------------------- JOINING INSTRUCTIONS AnCan Barniskis Meeting Room ONLINE Click here or paste this link into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer PHONE United States +1 (646) 749-3129 Canada +1 (647) 497-9373 Australia +61 2 9091 7603 Other national local access codes available at https://ancan.org/groups/joining-instructions/ Access Code: 222-583-973
Posts.Title: TONIGHT Women's Live Virtual BCa Support Group ... Thu May 2@ 8pm EDT

Posts.Content: AnCan's Advanced Cancer Caregiver Virtual Support Group - Tuesday, May 21 @ 5pm PST, 6pm MST, 7pm CST, 8pm EST http://bit.ly/2waTsVR These groups are live and interactive - audio/visual (optional). If you are a caregiver for someone with advanced cancer, or you know anyone who is, please let them know about this group. And we welcome the recently bereaved. Our peer moderators have both lived as caregivers to advanced cancer patients and also lost partners to cancer. Answer Cancer's Advanced Cancer Caregiver Virtual Support Group meets 8 pm Eastern time (5 pm Pacific) on both the first and third Tuesdays of the month.The group is FREE & DROP-IN; join online or by telephone - you can find the instructions for joining at the end of the message or on the home page of our new website, www.ancan.org. AnCan's caregiver meeting is a gentle, supportive, upbeat, peer-led space to talk - or just listen - about caregiving for any type of advanced cancer. We talk about whatever you wish to discuss - it is your time and space to talk about any- and everything caregiver related. We also welcome those who have recently lost loved one to discuss coping strategies. Renata Louwers, Debra Swiderski and Susan Lahaie co-moderate. Joining instructions are below; you can phone in or join via computer with just audio or audio plus video. All are welcome - it's free and drop-in! Please e-mail us with any questions. For more information please visit our website www.ancan.org. If you have specific questions about the caregiver's group, you can reach me at renata@ancan.org. You can reach AnCan for more general questions at info@ancan.org. We hope to talk with you soon! Onward & upwards, rick www.ancan.org --------------------------- JOINING INSTRUCTIONS ONLINE AnCan Barniskis Meeting Room Click here or paste the link below into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer To minimize background noise, please mute your mic when not speaking First time using GoToMeeting? Do a quick system check: https://link.gotomeeting.com/system-check PHONE United States +1 (646) 749-3129 Canada +1 (647) 497-9373 Australia +61 2 9091 7603 other national local access codes are available here http://www.ancan.org/joining-instructions/ Access Code: 222-583-973
Posts.Title: Adv. Cancer Caregivers Virtual Support Group - Tue, May 21 at 8 pm EDT

Posts.Content: If diagnosed even recently with one of a host of diseases, including breast & prostate cancer and many pulmonary conditions, and you frequented Lower Manhattan/ NW Brooklyn after the WTC collapsed in 2001, you may be entitled to both healthcare assistance and compensation through the 9-11 WTC Healthcare Fund and Victims' Compensation Fund. People who responded &/or lived and worked in Lower Manhattan during and after the Towers collapsed may be entitled to assistance with their medical costs and compensation. Many of these folks were diagnosed several years later and may have moved away, while First Responders visited from all parts of the country. Since only 90,000 claims have been processed and some 450,000 were impacted, a large number remain and many are unaware of their benefits. And many are men living with prostate cancer - unless their medical team were sharp enough to pick it up in the intake, they would never know their rights. Here's the link to our AnCan Webinar from Monday - https://ancan.org/listen-to-our-9-11-webinar-on-accessing-health... AnCan has no financial interest, nor stands to gain any financial benefit from promoting this message ....
Posts.Title: Were you regularly in Lower Manhattan post-9/11 .... ? $$$

Posts.Content: Speaking Freely Virtual Support Group - Thursday, May 16 @ 8 pm Eastern; 7 pm Central; 6 pm Mountain; 5 pm Pacific; 2 pm Hawaii Discuss all the non-medical aspects of living with cancer ... join us tonight! Speaking Freely is a support group for men with cancer, any cancer. It is a place for us to talk without being judged. Every man present has cancer ... you'll be among friends. We help each other and in doing so, we help ourselves. You have Cancer. Not the little "c"ancer like a magazine article. You have the big "C"ancer. The difference? Its now personal - you own cancer. Doctors, nurses, physicians assistants, lab techs and a host of other medical professionals will help with the medical side, the technical side of dealing with the seemingly unending events that you have been thrust into ..... they will explain the terms and test and results. They don't help much with the rest of your life ...... the unknown, the emotional roller coaster we received a front row ticket to ride. The concern about how to provide for your family, the aching fear you won't walk your daughter down the isle. The sense of loss in not feeling well enough to play with your grandson or the unfairness of not being able to play with your son. The embarrassment of incontinence, the shame of ED, the loss of intimacy with your partner. The format is informal, the conversation enlightening and encouraging. Please join us at 8pm EDT on the 3rd Thursday of each month and let your voice support your brothers. JOINING INSTRUCTIONS ONLINE Please join our meeting from your computer, tablet or smartphone. Paste the link below into your browser: https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer You will be using your microphone and speakers (VoIP). A USB headset is recommended for the best sound quality. To minimize background noise, please mute your mic when not speaking PHONE United States +1 (646) 749-3129 Canada +1 (647) 497-9373 Australia +61 2 9091 7603 For other countries, check http://www.ancan.org/joining-instructions/ Access Code: 222-583-973
